Enum Class TetrominoType

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<TetrominoType>
application.model.tetromino.TetrominoType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<TetrominoType>, Constable
public enum TetrominoType extends Enum<TetrominoType>
Defines the seven standard Tetris tetromino shapes (I, O, T, S, Z, L, J).

Each type stores a 4-rotation array of 2D shape matrices (int[rows][cols], 1 = filled, 0 = empty) and a color name string used by the renderer to pick the correct block sprite.

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    I
    I-piece (cyan): 4-long bar in a 4×4 bounding box (SRS standard).
    J
    J-piece (blue): J-shape in a 3×3 bounding box (SRS standard).
    L
    L-piece (orange): L-shape in a 3×3 bounding box (SRS standard).
    O
    O-piece (yellow): 2×2 square.
    S
    S-piece (green): S/skew in a 3×3 bounding box (SRS standard).
    T
    T-piece (purple): T-shape in a 3×3 bounding box (SRS standard).
    Z
    Z-piece (red): Z/skew in a 3×3 bounding box (SRS standard).

  • Enum Constant Details

    • I

      public static final TetrominoType I
      I-piece (cyan): 4-long bar in a 4×4 bounding box (SRS standard).

    • O

      public static final TetrominoType O
      O-piece (yellow): 2×2 square. All rotations are identical.

    • T

      public static final TetrominoType T
      T-piece (purple): T-shape in a 3×3 bounding box (SRS standard).

      public int[][] getShape(int rotation)
      Returns a defensive copy of the shape matrix for the given rotation state.
      Parameters:
      rotation - the rotation index (0–3); values outside this range are wrapped using modulo 4
      Returns:
      a new 2D int array representing the shape
